item.title: Mia add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
item.description: "I get so tired of moral bookkeeping." -- Katherine Anne Porter

item.title: Mia add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mia add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mia add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Mia add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Telling me I can do anything I want is like pulling the plug out of the bath and then telling the water it can go anywhere it wants. Try it, and see what happens." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Mia add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Somebody's boring me. I think it's me." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Mia add a quote by Richard Greenberg
item.description: "You know, the thing is with people who never talk, the thing is you always suppose they're harbouring some enormous secret. But, just possibly, the secret is, they have absolutely nothing to say." -- Richard Greenberg

item.title: Mia add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "Why did everything always change when all you wanted, all you had ever humbly asked of whatever God there might be, was that certain things be allowed to stay the same?" -- Richard Yates

item.title: Mia add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mia add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Mia add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Everyone should be able to do one card trick, tell two jokes, and recite three poems, in case they are ever trapped in an elevator." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Mia add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Mia add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Mia add a quote by Helene Hanff
item.description: "I do love secondhand books that open to the page some previous owner read oftenest. The day Hazlitt came he opened to "I hate to read new books," and I hollered "Comrade!" to whoever owned it before me." -- Helene Hanff

item.title: Mia add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Mia add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Mia add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Mia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mia add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "I have never been able to resist a book about books." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Mia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mia add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Perhaps there is some secret sort of homing instinct in books that brings them to their perfect readers. How delightful if that were true." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Mia add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "I much prefer whining to counting my blessings." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Mia add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "If you truly love a book, you should sleep with it, write in it, read aloud from it, and fill its pages with muffin crumbs." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Mia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mia add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
Mia add a quote by Megan McCafferty
item.description: "You. Yes You" -- Megan McCafferty

item.title: Mia add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "When I was your age, television was called books." -- William Goldman

item.title: Mia add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Mia add a quote by E. M. Delafield
item.description: "Am sorry to note that abuse and condemnation of a common acquaintance often constitutes very strong bond of union between otherwise uncongenial spirits." -- E. M. Delafield
